definition: The School Sayings of Confucius (abbr. for 孔子家語|孔子家语[Kong3 zi3 Jia1 yu3])

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
to tell to
dialect/language/speech
The School Sayings of Confucius, a supplement to the Analects/abbr. to 家語|家语[Jia1 yu3]
Hakka (a Chinese dialect)
courtesy name for Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
to explain/to interpret/interpretation
historical biography
another name for Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
to speak/to say
Master Zhu, another name for Zhu Xi 朱熹
Yi Zhuan, commentary on the "Book of Changes" or "I Ching" 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
see 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
"Mr Lü's Annals", same as 呂氏春秋|吕氏春秋[Lu:3 shi4 Chun1 qiu1]
vulgar/philistine
refined (of writing)
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
surname Wu
I/my (old)
Chu Ci, the Songs of Chu (ancient book of poems, collected during Han but esp. from country of Chu c. 500 BC)
spoken language/vernacular
